newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Goulandris ups Waterford Wedgwood stake.
newsitem.headline: Goulandris ups Waterford Wedgwood stake.

text.p: Waterford Wedgwood Plc said on Wednesday that Araquipa International Limited, a company controlled by Peter John Goulandris, had acquired 26.5 million stock units in the group from a limited partnership controlled by Morgan Stanley Capital Partners.

Goulandris' shareholding in the group has increased to 6.247 percent from 2.608 percent while Morgan Stanley Capital Partners' stake, held through Shuttleway, has fallen to around 3.64 percent from 7.28 percent, Waterford Wedgwood said in a statement.
Goulandris, a brother-in-law of Waterford Wedgwood chairman Tony O'Reilly, acquired the stock units pursuant to the exercise on March 25 of an option by Araquipa.
The price on exercise of this option was 85.9 Irish pence per share, the average mid-market price over the five dealing days before the closing of the acquisition on Tuesday.
As a result of Araquipa's purchase and an unrelated disposal, Shuttleway's holding in Waterford Wedgwood has been reduced to 19.938 percent.
Irish industrial holding group Fitzwilton Plc is also involved in Shuttleway.

As a result of the disposal of the Morgan Stanley Capital Partners shareholding, Fitzwilton controls 81.75 percent of the stock units held by Shuttleway, representing 16.3 percent of the current issued share capital of the group.
Fitzwilton's interest in Waterford Wedgwood remains unchanged at 12.79 percent.
